intro: Restio humilis, commonly known as the dwarf restia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in Mediterranean climates. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are often hairy and arranged in dense tufts. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white flowers. Restio humilis is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
